intro: Cerastium buffumiae, commonly known as the Buffum's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically rounded and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
